intro: Chaubardia, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plants are evergreen shrubs characterized by their small, leathery leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Chaubardia species are adapted to high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or well-drained soils. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
